concept of a collection which is essentially the database where we store facial vectors it's all you need to do

done all you need to do is take your video or image and then search against
the collection so it's a three-step process but it's very easy to get started so with this the beauty is you control

location count as well as relationships of objects so what I mean by that is
once you have the bounding box around each object you could now have more

of the video and activities again you know in this case it would be playing soccer or it could be different things

extension of this you know content compliance or safety or content moderation that's also a key theme that
we hear and at recognition we have taken a slightly different approach to this
problem and I'll tell you why that is so if you notice this is the output that
you get out of our content moderation api's today and you will notice that it's a hierarchical set of labels
there's a reason why we don't say that something is safe or unsafe simply because there is no one standard right
so we we don't consider ourselves an authority on what is to be considered
safe or unsafe all we know is these types of labels are you know different
customers have different needs based on these so what we do is we give them out we give them out with confidence score
and you the customer can then create your own business rules for example you
could just say look I don't want anything with any kind of explicit nudity or suggestive content so maybe
you're operating in the Middle East and anything is you know mildly just've also
is not a great experience or you could say look as long as it's not you know
really pornographic in nature I'm fine so you could allow the suggestive content to go through and just the
explicit nudity could be filtered out or you could use this for ratings as well because if you figure out the type of
nudity you could assign different ratings for the content so this is really a bunch of stuff and that's why
we have chosen to go the route of just giving you information allowing you to make the decisions yourselves and the
beauty of content moderation is that it's a problem that many people are you
know facing today and the most common way of doing this at scale is just humanely checking every piece of content
either the image or the video and so essentially you are trying to find a needle in a giant haystack
because on most reputable platforms what we have seen is the actual amount of
unsafe content could be as low as one or two percent or even lesser and but you
do have to look at everything to find that thing so our approach is to essentially shrink the size of that
haystack maybe it was the size of her warehouse and now you know it's just a small box so as you can see here coffee
meets bagel one of the most popular dating website apps sorry we're able to
you know save a lot of manpower on this so 97% of the manual effort went away
because recognition could flag the content which was potentially unsafe and
then the humans could just look at that and so this freed them up to do more higher value work and of course this
